bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Campus Activities Office was originally created as the Office of Student Actvities in 1973 under the direction of the Vice president of Student Affairs. It was renamed in 1975. Currently the office falls under the jurisdiction of the Dean of the College and is responsibile for coordinating "student extracurricular activities and all nonacademic scheduling, including the College Center and evening use of all auditoria. The office maintains the College calendar...manages convocations and commencement and makes arrangements for academic dress." Campus Activities also manages the Palmer Gallery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Chronological and subject files relating to events including Vassar Student Association conferences, Founder’s Day, Commencement and other events and activities. Also includes Palmer Gallery records, such as exhibition publications, correspondence with artists, artists’ resumes and samples of their works.
